Cat02.synopsis: A cat you can send over to Derryth Bonecloak if Baelen is dead. It speaks in rolled r's and is very difficult to understand.
Cat02.how_to_trigger: Talk to one of the cats outside of Bonecloak's Apothecary.

Derryth.synopsis: The player talks to Derryth after she returns from the Underdark, with or without the Noblestalk.
Derryth.how_to_trigger: Use debug book --> set flags --> act 3, bonecloaks to chooe path.Head to Bonecloak's Apothecary (-26.995; 26.776; -38.02) and speak with Derryth, the dwarf behind the counter. OR Head to the Elfsong Tavern (59.447; 41.372; -2.144) and speak to Derryth there.oe: LOW_BaelenDead , LOW_BaelenHealed , LOW_GaveNoblestalk

AD_DerrythBossingBaelen.synopsis: Derryth coldly bosses Baelen around as the players enter the Bonecloak Apothecary.
AD_DerrythBossingBaelen.how_to_trigger: Head to Bonecloak's Apothecary with the Bonecloaks alive and without having healed Baelen.

Cat03.synopsis: A cat you can send over to Derryth Bonecloak if Baelen is dead. It speaks in rolled r's and is very difficult to understand.
Cat03.how_to_trigger: Only appears if Baelen died in Act 1 and Derryth has told you she is lonely.

Mohan.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Talk to |Mohan| - S_LOW_BonecloakApothecary_Mohan - f28c5212-4eaa-476b-bfa7-9c43302d54aa - (-18 26 -46)

AD_DerrythMeetsCat.synopsis: Derryth finds herself as a landlady to a cat tenant. She's quite taken with the creature, but is still coming to terms with it a little.
AD_DerrythMeetsCat.how_to_trigger: Baelen must be dead.Derryth must have confided in the player that she is lonely.Convince a nearby cat to move in.Return to the apothecary after the cat as arrived.

Cat01.synopsis: A cat you can send over to Derryth Bonecloak if Baelen is dead. It speaks in rolled r's and is very difficult to understand.
Cat01.how_to_trigger: Speak to one of the cats outside of the Bonecloak Apothecary.

Baelen.synopsis: If Baelen survives the Underdark, you can talk to him in the Bonecloak Apothecary upon your arrival in LOW. He is either running the shop after harrying his wife away for the last time, or his mind is almost completely gone and he is effectively Derryth's servant.
Baelen.how_to_trigger: Resolve the Mushroom Hunter situation in UND with Baelen still alive, and then nagivate to the Bonecloak Apothecary. Talk to Baelen.

Cat02_5.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_5.text: You have delivered unto me a most studious disciple - when you next hear thunder, know it is Sharess herself purring her approval.

Cat02_22.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_22.text: Yes? Will you now heed the most splendid Sharess' call?

Cat02_15.speaker: Player
Cat02_15.text: Well, you're an excitable little thing.

Cat02_14.speaker: Player
Cat02_14.text: Try and scare the cat away.

Cat02_44.speaker: Player
Cat02_44.text: If you want more of that, you should befriend Derryth Bonecloak back there.

Cat02_32.speaker: Player
Cat02_32.text: Do you want to be my friend, puss?

Cat02_40.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_40.text: Hold, seeker! Have you come to swear yourself to Sharess by my paw?

Cat02_17.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_17.text: Mother of Cats! Feline of Felicity! The only deity one should ever swear fealty to in these nine lives!

Cat02_3.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_3.text: Now - will you heed our Mother's call, and bolster her as she crushes the heathen Absolute beneath her divine paw?

Cat02_27.speaker: Player
Cat02_27.text: I know someone who'd truly appreciate Sharess' guidance in her time of need.

Cat02_6.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_6.text: Who? Speak their name and I shall bring them the full force of Sharess' soporific glory!

Cat02_34.speaker: Player
Cat02_34.text: Derryth Bonecloak - she's just lost someone and could use some solace.

Cat02_45.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_45.text: The apothecary? But of course! Sharess has sent me a fine new disciple and purveyor of the sacred herb!

Cat02_1.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_1.text: I shall bring her Sharess' wisdom and she will provide catnip for our ecstatic visions!

Cat02_8.speaker: Player
Cat02_8.text: Actually never mind - it's better if you focus your priestly attentions here.

Cat02_12.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_12.text: It is as you say - I shall sing the hymns of Sharess to the stars as she intended!

Cat02_2.speaker: Player
Cat02_2.text: Yes - I pledge myself to Sharess.

Cat02_48.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_48.text: Yes! Yes! Together we shall spread the word of the wonder in her every pawstep!

Cat02_46.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_46.text: I will sing her name in the streets, and you will bring her prayers to those suffering two legs instead of four.

Cat02_33.speaker: Player
Cat02_33.text: I know somebody who needs to hear Sharess' word straight from the mouth of her most loyal priest.

Cat02_52.speaker: Player
Cat02_52.text: Uh, yes. I will definitely do that.

Cat02_41.speaker: Player
Cat02_41.text: I'm not sure Sharess is the goddess for me.

Cat02_43.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_43.text: Sharess shall mourn your absence - but always honour your capriciousness as her own.
Cat02_43.context: NodeContext: A little disheartened but respectful of the player's choice

Cat02_23.speaker: Player
Cat02_23.text: From one follower of a deity to another, I must respectfully decline.

Cat02_35.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_35.text: Ah, a fellow priest. You may walk on two legs, but we still see eye to eye.

Cat02_13.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_13.text: May your dusks be long and your hunger fleeting.

Cat02_21.speaker: Barsik
Cat02_21.text: Yes and no. Your kind has lost their way in their worship of the Feline of Felicity - you only hold to her basest tenets.
Cat02_21.context: NodeContext: Zealous still but somewhat disapproving

Derryth_9.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_9.text: Huh! Now there's a mug I won't soon forget.

Derryth_138.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_138.text: How's that noblestalk treating you, eh? Better be good. 'Shroom's why our customers came. We're out on our arses soon enough without it, I hope you know.

Derryth_72.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_72.text: Gee, thanks. Looks like you grew a conscience after all.
Derryth_72.context: NodeContext: She's grateful but also annoyed with the player.

Derryth_76.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_76.text: This'll help. I'll be able to propagate a fair few from this one, too. Come back another day and I may have some for you. At a fair price.

Derryth_14.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_14.text: Look who it is! You're just in time - noblestalk's propagated a treat. Have a look.

Derryth_21.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_21.text: Hey, you. Take a look at this cat. Does he look like a 'Harry' to you?

Derryth_18.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_18.text: Bah! No it isn't. I'll call him... Walrus.

Derryth_49.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_49.text: Livens the place up, doesn't he? Yes he does, indeed he does!
Derryth_49.context: NodeContext: First bit to the player, second to the cat on the ground.

Derryth_115.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_115.text: Please. It's a cat, not a clown. But he's no 'Harry' either, is he? I think I'll call him... Walrus.

Derryth_123.speaker: Player
Derryth_123.text: I don't care what you name your cat.

Derryth_141.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_141.text: Suit yourself. Me and... Walrus - that suits you, doesn't it, you lovely thing? - don't need your help anyhow.

Derryth_56.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_56.text: Bonecloak's. Get what you can before we have to shutter the place.

Derryth_133.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_133.text: If you came for noblestalk, you're out of luck. Last trip to the Underdark was a miserable failure. Won't be able to keep the lamps lit much longer.

Derryth_45.speaker: Player
Derryth_45.text: As it happens, I already have some noblestalk to hand.

Derryth_19.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_19.text: You... but... how?! Well... never mind how. Listen here: if you give me that mushroom, I'll propagate it to the Hells and back.

Derryth_40.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_40.text: I'll give you a discount on everything here, and... well... you'll be keeping food in my mouth and a roof over my head for months.

Derryth_54.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_54.text: I ain't a beggar. But. Please.
Derryth_54.context: NodeContext: A hard woman softening out of necessity.

Derryth_58.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_58.text: Cat's crabs, you've saved my arse. Come back tomorrow, hey? There'll be more of the stuff already. Grows like a weed in the right hands. And erm. Thank you. Very much.
Derryth_58.context: NodeContext: Hardness returned to her, but she's happy now

Derryth_135.speaker: Player
Derryth_135.text: You sound like a beggar to me.

Derryth_75.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_75.text: Maybe. But if you ever find yourself down on your luck, I hope you'll receive the same kindness I'm asking for now.

Derryth_136.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_136.text: Well. You've every right to it. If you see me on the streets in future, throw me a copper or two, eh?

Derryth_94.speaker: Player
Derryth_94.text: You get your wares from the Underdark?

Derryth_117.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_117.text: Only place to find our best-seller. Noblestalk's this place's bread and butter - milk and eggs, too. Without it, we're sunk.

Derryth_62.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_62.text: What can I do you for?

Derryth_37.speaker: Player
Derryth_37.text: I'd like to give you that noblestalk.

Derryth_65.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_65.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

Derryth_107.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_107.text: Welcome to Bonecloak's. Doors are still open thanks to that noblestalk you helped us with.
Derryth_107.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

Derryth_20.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_20.text: We've even enough left over to keep ourselves fed. Not that Baelen's worth the gold it takes to keep him fattened up.
Derryth_20.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

Derryth_53.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_53.text: Anyway. We can knock a little off the top if you've a mind to buy.
Derryth_53.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

Derryth_116.speaker: Player
Derryth_116.text: How are you and Baelen getting on?

Derryth_48.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_48.text: He's wrecking my head, as always. Makes himself useful with a broom from time to time, at least.

Derryth_8.speaker: Player
Derryth_8.text: You might lighten up on Baelen. He seems harmless enough.

Derryth_51.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_51.text: You don't know him like I do. He may play the lamb, but beneath it all, he's a black-hearted ogre. I got the scars to prove it.

Derryth_55.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_55.text: Anyway. You ought to keep your nose in your own corner. You might upset folk.

Derryth_68.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_68.text: Hope you're here to buy something.

Derryth_69.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_69.text: Huh. It's you. I never forget a face.

Derryth_59.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_59.text: Noblestalk is why the customers came. We were out on our arses soon enough without it. Too bad my worthless fella couldn't get one simple thing right in his life.

Derryth_80.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_80.text: Get what you can while the getting's good. We'll be closing our doors soon enough.

Derryth_104.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_104.text: We mostly trade in noblestalk, and my fool of a fella Baelen never came back with any.

Derryth_118.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_118.text: If the old sack was going to die, he could've brought back some noblestalk beforehand. Without the bloody fungus, Bonecloak's days are numbered.

Derryth_109.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_109.text: It's the least you could do.

Derryth_77.speaker: Player
Derryth_77.text: How are you getting along without Baelen?

Derryth_108.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_108.text: Well. It's a lot quieter without him bumbling about the place. He was on the slow fade out anyway.

Derryth_139.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_139.text: He was a terror most of his life, you know. Mean. Drunk. Got a few scars I could show you that'd make you wince.

Derryth_73.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_73.text: When he got sick, I was grateful for the relief. But so angry, too.

Derryth_10.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_10.text: We both of us deserved better than life gave us. Now he's off in the City of Judgement, probably wasting away unclaimed, the old heathen. And I'm here. Alone.

Derryth_57.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_57.text: Just fine, now Walrus is here to keep me company. Isn't that right, precious?

Derryth_98.speaker: Player
Derryth_98.text: Are you glad to be back in Baldur's Gate?

Derryth_120.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_120.text: Oh, sure. Cultists on the loose, a murderer hacking people to bits, and big metal freaks stomping hither, thither, and yon.

Derryth_16.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_16.text: The place is in shambles, to be honest. But Walrus softens the blow.

Derryth_121.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_121.text: That noblestalk you gave me helped, though. It's what keeps the customers coming. Bloody fungus is all that keeps our candles lit.

Derryth_60.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_60.text: You could've done me a great turn with that noblestalk. It's what attracted the customers. Won't be able to keep the candles lit without it. Hope that pleases you.

Derryth_81.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_81.text: Well! Aren't you a sight for sore eyes? Made it out of the Underdark in one piece, I see.
Derryth_81.context: NodeContext: More jovial than usual. She's doing well.

Derryth_17.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_17.text: I owe you a debt of gratitude, believe it or not. When you healed my husband, Baelen, I thought my life was over. Turns out it was just beginning.

Derryth_38.speaker: Player
Derryth_38.text: I met him in your shop. He seems to be doing well.

Derryth_102.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_102.text: Happy as a pig in shit, I'm sure. Eighty years we've been married. Seventy of 'em, he was a mean, violent man who loved nothing but the drink.
Derryth_102.context: NodeContext: With a scoff, bitterness in her voice.

Derryth_106.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_106.text: Him losing his mind softened him and hardened me. I hated him so much - more than I knew a person could carry. And now I wasn't too scared to show it.

Derryth_101.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_101.text: But it brought no relief. Not really. So when you turned him back, I turned mine.

Derryth_4.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_4.text: I don't have much now. But a bit of peace is worth an awful lot.

Derryth_112.speaker: Player
Derryth_112.text: Glad to see you're doing well.

Derryth_39.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_39.text: You know what? So am I. And I hope Baelen finds his peace while he still can, too.

Derryth_64.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_64.text: It's nice to see a familiar face. After living a handsbreadth away from Baelen most of my life, I've forgotten how to be alone.
Derryth_64.context: NodeContext: With a little sigh, reflecting.

Derryth_36.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_36.text: Maybe I'll get to courting after a little while. Then again, maybe I'll just get a cat.

Derryth_91.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_91.text: You take care now, all right? Be sure you do. Life's too short not to.

Derryth_13.speaker: Player
Derryth_13.text: I wish you both the best.

Derryth_95.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_95.text: Thank you. Baelen won't agree with me, but I say we both deserve it.

Derryth_110.speaker: Player
Derryth_110.text: The two of you deserve each other.

Derryth_5.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_5.context: NodeContext: With a little bit of humor. Player is being mean to her but she's not taking the bait.

Derryth_119.speaker: Player
Derryth_119.text: So he got well, and you left him?

Derryth_89.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_89.text: Sure I did. Before he could do me any worse damage than he did for the first seventy years of our marriage.

Derryth_129.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_129.text: Had to be practical about it. Slip out while he slept. I knew if I stayed there, it'd be the death of me.

Derryth_41.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_41.text: Baelen made my life hell. And when I had the chance to return the favour, I took it. That's no way to live. Now we're both free.

Derryth_33.speaker: Player
Derryth_33.text: What will you do now that you're done with the shop?

Derryth_2.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_2.text: The shop. The bloody shop. Thing was like a noose around my neck, getting tighter every day.

Derryth_35.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_35.text: You don't realise how much your life is choking you until you can breathe again.

Derryth_70.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_70.text: Turns out I didn't hate life. I hated that life.
Derryth_70.context: NodeContext: She breathes in deeply through her nose, a sigh of contentment

Derryth_42.speaker: Player
Derryth_42.text: I admit, I was worried about the two of you.

Derryth_124.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_124.text: You should've been. Baelen was an awful, violent man. Would've killed me if I stayed. And truth be told, if you hadn't healed him, I might've done the same to him.

Derryth_93.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_93.text: I know you. So you made it out of the Underdark. More'n I can say for Baelen.

Derryth_145.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Derryth_145.text: Huh! Now there's a mug I won't soon forget.

AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_7.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_7.text: Not like that, you old goat.

AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_1.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_1.text: Didn't anyone teach you to sweep toward the door?

AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_3.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_3.text: We'll need more business than this to keep the place afloat.

AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_6.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythBossingBaelen_6.text: Maybe if you didn't eat enough for three, Baelen, you glutton.

Cat03_19.speaker: Malta
Cat03_19.text: Upon their return, the cat couldn't help but wonder whether the tall one had finally decided how their die would be cast.

Cat03_14.speaker: Player
Cat03_14.text: Hello, sour puss. Do you want scritches?

Cat03_30.speaker: Narrator
Cat03_30.text: *The cat seems to be trying very hard to remain aloof - and not wholly succeeding.*

Cat03_41.speaker: Player
Cat03_41.text: If you're brave enough, I'm sure Derryth Bonecloak at the apothecary will pet you all you want.

Cat03_29.speaker: Player
Cat03_29.text: Do you want to come with me?

Cat03_32.speaker: Malta
Cat03_32.text: The cat beheld the one who'd delivered him from the streets while taking on the heavy burden of justice alone. He purred.
Cat03_32.context: NodeContext: Intense narration - but a little softer/more content now

Cat03_37.speaker: Malta
Cat03_37.text: It was another day in the city of lies. Baldur's Gate - where the people begged for justice until they starved.

Cat03_36.speaker: Malta
Cat03_36.text: Two heroes were fated to cross paths that day. Their eyes met. Destiny was calling...

Cat03_17.speaker: Malta
Cat03_17.text: Strangers? Only in a fool's definition of the word.

Cat03_5.speaker: Malta
Cat03_5.text: It was the start of something incredible - two heroes on the hunt for justice, no matter the cost.

Cat03_11.speaker: Malta
Cat03_11.text: All the tall one had to do was say yes.

Cat03_22.speaker: Player
Cat03_22.text: I don't think I'm the partner for you - but Derryth Bonecloak be just who you're looking for.

Cat03_42.speaker: Malta
Cat03_42.text: The tall one volunteered another - the apothecary. A principled dwarf - a scritcher of heads, and a giver of scraps.

Cat03_6.speaker: Malta
Cat03_6.text: Perhaps this was where the journey was meant to start after all...

Cat03_27.speaker: Malta
Cat03_27.text: The tall one had failed the first test: they lacked caution. The cat could have just as easily been a foe as a potential friend.

Cat03_20.speaker: Malta
Cat03_20.text: Perhaps it was simply not meant to be...

Cat03_35.speaker: Player
Cat03_35.text: Sorry - our destines aren't meant to intertwine.

Cat03_39.speaker: Malta
Cat03_39.text: The tall one had passed the first test. The second would come when they were ready - and not before.

Cat03_33.speaker: Malta
Cat03_33.text: When would they be ready? Only the tall one - and fate - truly knew.

Cat03_18.speaker: Malta
Cat03_18.text: Destiny is a fickle mistress. She showers you in riches one day and kicks you into the gutter the next. But today, she smiles.

Cat03_9.speaker: Malta
Cat03_9.text: This could be the beginning of something. Two heroes against the world, enacting justice for those unable to seek their own.

Cat03_25.speaker: Malta
Cat03_25.text: It was in the tall one's voice: they knew they cared about this creature but they didn't know why. But the cat did.

Mohan_17.speaker: Player
Mohan_17.text: I don't think I caught your name before. Or anything else about you, for that matter.

Mohan_21.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_21.text: Forgive me. My name is Mohan. I'm a... consultant, of sorts. Whenever someone worth knowing needs something worth having, there I am.

Mohan_16.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_16.text: And I have a good feeling about you.

Mohan_13.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_13.text: Ah - I was hoping to bump into you sooner or later.

Mohan_18.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_18.text: I've heard about you. I know the so-called 'saviour' of this city has taken an interest in you. One thing I've learned: real saviours never label themselves as such.

Mohan_1.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_1.text: 'Lord'. A fine title for the greatest scoundrel in town.

Mohan_11.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_11.text: Imagine wagging your big metal willies up and down the thoroughfares and calling yourself 'Archduke'. Pathetic.

Mohan_15.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_15.text: He needs a proper challenge. And from what I've heard, you're the person to give it to him.

Mohan_12.speaker: Player
Mohan_12.text: Where have you heard of me?

Mohan_23.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_23.text: I like to keep my ear to the ground. If there's someone knocking around who I think could use a good turn, I try to, well, turn them.

Mohan_27.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_27.text: I might not have exactly what you need, but I remain at your service. Have a look, at least.

Mohan_6.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_6.text: Godspeed. And come back whenever you need something.

Mohan_24.speaker: Player
Mohan_24.text: Do you mean Gortash? He's dead now, thanks to me.

Mohan_2.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_2.text: But Baldur's Gate isn't out of danger yet, is it? Gortash was one bad actor. Delightful you stomped the light out of him. But from what I hear, there could be more.

Mohan_19.speaker: Player
Mohan_19.text: If you mean Gortash, I doubt he's ever even saved anyone a seat, much less a city.

Mohan_3.speaker: Mohan
Mohan_3.text: Ha! You know, I'm sure you're very right.

Mohan_28.speaker: Player
Mohan_28.text: That's nice, but I'm just here to shop. May I see your wares?

AD_DerrythMeetsCat_0.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythMeetsCat_0.text: The shop has plenty of little pests for you to hunt.

AD_DerrythMeetsCat_1.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythMeetsCat_1.text: You're a precious little thing, aren't you? Would you like to live here with me?

AD_DerrythMeetsCat_2.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythMeetsCat_2.text: You can eat the fish, but stay away from the mushrooms.

AD_DerrythMeetsCat_3.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
AD_DerrythMeetsCat_3.text: You need a name. Mouse-Mauler... Gwynevere... Meowdenkainen... Rodentsbane.

Cat01_33.speaker: Narrator
Cat01_33.text: *The cat seems reluctant to part from you.*

Cat01_43.speaker: Player
Cat01_43.text: If you'd like a companion, Derryth at Bonecloak's Apothecary could use a friend.

Cat01_6.speaker: Player
Cat01_6.text: Try to decipher the cat's strange speech.

Cat01_9.speaker: Narrator
Cat01_9.text: *It speaks a feline dialect called 'Mriaer'. It wants to know if you're its mother.*

Cat01_28.speaker: Player
Cat01_28.text: No. But I do know someone in want of a cat companion. Her name is Derryth Bonecloak.

Cat01_41.speaker: Player
Cat01_41.text: I might know a mother for you. But you'll have to pitch yourself first.

Cat01_36.speaker: Myshka
Cat01_36.text: Errr erm a kert. Er gerrrrrd kert.
Cat01_36.context: NodeContext: "I am a cat. A good cat."

Cat01_35.speaker: Player
Cat01_35.text: Sold! You'll want to find Derryth at Bonecloak's Apothecary.

Cat01_8.speaker: Player
Cat01_8.text: Hmm, in that case, I don't think it'll be a good fit.

Baelen_1.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_1.text: Well! Look what the cat dragged in. Haven't seen you since you cleared up me ol' noggin in the Underdark.

Baelen_17.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_17.text: Nor should you. 'Tis a beautiful day to be alive.

Baelen_7.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_7.text: Fled in the night and haven't seen her ugly face since. For the best; she was cruising for a lesson after what she did.

Baelen_32.speaker: Player
Baelen_32.text: I wouldn't have healed you if I knew you were a violent man.

Baelen_30.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_30.text: Don't you be judging me. Sure you made it to the city with curtsies and cajoles, is that right?

Baelen_13.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_13.text: I didn't think so. So don't you be judging me.

Baelen_6.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_6.text: Only the finest. And to thank you for your good help, I'll take a lot off the top - just for you.

Baelen_28.speaker: Player
Baelen_28.text: How are things in the city?

Baelen_12.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_12.text: To quote you, I can't complain. I hear this and that about Absolutists in the city and someone running around on a murder spree, but I haven't had any trouble.

Baelen_27.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_27.text: If I'm lucky, they'll go for Derryth next. Heh!

Baelen_18.speaker: Player
Baelen_18.text: Glad to see you up and about.

Baelen_10.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_10.text: Thanks to you. If I hadn't run into you in that mushroom field, my old bag Derryth would've had me at her beck and call to this day.

Baelen_2.speaker: Player
Baelen_2.text: Not as chipper as you, it seems.

Baelen_4.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_4.text: No time to waste dragging my feet. Got to make up for the time I wasted while my brains were inside out.

Baelen_21.speaker: Player
Baelen_21.text: Good, but I need supplies. Got anything to trade?

Baelen_22.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_22.text: Have a good long gander, now.

Baelen_16.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_16.text: It's Bonecloak's! I'm Baelen. Hello, nice to meet you.

Baelen_24.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_24.text: We sell all sorts of ingredients and goods.

Baelen_19.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
Baelen_19.text: Go on, Baelen, get on with it then.

Baelen_9.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_9.text: Derryth's coming back soon. Stepped out, she has. I'll keep an eye out.

Baelen_34.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Baelen_34.text: I've got to finish this, now. Bye!
Baelen_34.context: NodeContext: whispered, maybe hand next to mouth like telling a secret. friendly
